intro: Launaea hafunensis, commonly known as Hafun dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showing adaptations to withstand drought conditions. Its leaves are usually lobed and may have a hairy texture, while the flowers are small and yellow, forming a composite head. Launaea hafunensis is often found in sandy soils and can thrive in coastal areas.
